intro: Senecio cleeffii, commonly known as the Cleeff's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Senecio cleeffii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
